name: paper production, woodfree, uncoated, at non-integrated mill | paper, woodfree, uncoated | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8371/documentation

Woodfree, uncoated paper (also called uncoated fine paper) is one of the most important categories of graphical paper. It contains most of the office papers (e.g. business forms, copier, computer, stationery and book paper). Woodfree paper is defined as containing at least 90% of the fibres in form of chemical pulp. Uncoated paper is defined as not being coated with a coating material like kaolin or calcium carbonate. This dataset represents the production at non-integrated mills which means that market pulp is bought as an input for paper production. ;;The main sources for the dataset are several environmental reports from European paper mills (Neusiedler (2001), Kymi (1999), Kymi (2001), Nordland Papier (2001)) an the Finnish EcoData database from KCL (KCL (2002)).;;Further sources are the German inventory study about graphical paper (Tiedemann et al. (2000)) and the European IPPC documentation for the paper and pulp industry (European Commission (2000)).;;References ;KCL (2002) KCL EcoData - life cycle inventory database. The Finnish Pulp and Paper Research Institute (KCL), Espoo (Finnland);;Kymi (1999) Environmental Report 1999. UPM-Kymmene Kymi Paper Oy, Kuusankoski (Finland) as pdf-File under: http://www.paper.upm-kymmene.com;;Kymi (2001) Kymi Paper Oy Environmental Protection in 2000. UPM-Kymmene Kymi Paper Oy, Kuusankoski (Finland) as pdf-File under: http://www.paper.upm-kymmene.com;;Neusiedler (2001) Umwelterklärung der Neusiedler AG - Standort Ulmerfeld-Hausmening. Neusiedler AG, Ulmerfeld-Hausmening (Austria) as pdf-File under: http://www.neusiedler.at/2001/de/pdf/umwelterklaerung_the_2001.pdf;;Nordland Papier (2001) Umwelterklärung 2001. UPM-Kymmene Nordland Papier AG, Dörpen (Germany) as pdf-File under: http://www.paper.upm-kymmene.com;;Further References;European Commission (2000) Integrated Pollution Prevention and Control (IPPC) - Reference Document on Best Available Techniques in the Pulp and Paper Industry. Institute for Prospective Technological Studies, Sevilla;;Tiedemann A., Böttcher Tiedemann C., Buschardt A., Georgi B., Giersberg G., Goosmann G., Gregor H.-D., Mehlhorn B., Modi A., Neitzel H., Oels H.-J., Schmitz S. and Suhr M. (2000) Ökobilanzen für graphische Papiere. Texte 22/00. Umweltbundesamt, Berlin

This activity starts with the reception of the raw materials, such as sulfate market pulp.

This dataset represents European production of uncoated, woodfree paper in a non-integrated mill - including pulp preparation, paper production, energy production on-site and internal wastewater treatment.
category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1701:Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data represent the average technology in the late 1990ies and early 2000s. The production volume is valid for 2018.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from several European fine paper producers used as European average data.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on literature and statistics (see dataset field “Published Source”)
